title: Rania al-Abdullah | Queen of Jordan, Husband, & Social Media | Britannica

quotes: she earned a degree in business administration from the American University in Cairo (1991)
In January 1993 she met Abdullah, then a prince, at a dinner party, and they were engaged two months later.
On June 10, 1993, Rania and Abdullah were married, and Rania became a princess.
When Abdullah’s father, King Hussein, died in 1999, Abdullah succeeded him as king of Jordan, and shortly thereafter he elevated Rania from princess to queen.
in March 2008 she launched a video blog as part of her efforts to deconstruct stereotypes about Arabs and promote dialogue with the West.

As queen of Jordan, Rania championed an array of causes, including the rights of women and children, access to education, environmental concerns, and the development of strong Jordanian communities.
